page.title: 02DEVORAN VILLAGE
page.content: On Market Street there is a master bakery, newsagent and general stores, also the school and church hall, which occupies the old market house. The playing field next to the school is being levelled. Along St Johns Tce is the Post Office and the Devoran Inn, once named the Commercial Inn. Nearby is the Methodist church. The Village hall is in Quay Road alongside the surgery. On Devoran Lane, not far from St Johns Church and Vicarage, is the Driffold Hotel. Further along is a modern housing estate, still under construction. Along Greenbank Road are the Dolphin Link H.Q.,a tannery, weld- ed mesh manufacturer and a Funeral Di- rector. Devoran Filling Station is on the A39, beyond which is Visick's Foundry and Boatyard. Also on the main road is a firm which sells and ser- vices lawn mowers.
